warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Extend arms to the sides and make small circles forward for 30 seconds, then backward for 30 seconds.
Rotate shoulders forward in a circular motion for 30 seconds, then backward for 30 seconds.
Twist your torso from side to side, keeping your core engaged. 30 seconds.

warmup_exercises.setup_notes: Start on your hands and knees.
warmup_exercises.execution_notes: Inhale, drop your belly towards the floor, and lift your chest and tailbone. Exhale, round your spine towards the ceiling, tucking your chin to your chest. Repeat for 1 minute.
Gently pull your elbow towards your body using your other hand. Hold for 15 seconds. Repeat on the other side. 30 seconds total.

exercises.setup: Sit down at a lat pull-down machine and adjust the knee pad to fit snugly against your thighs. Grip the bar with a wide overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Sit upright with your back straight, core engaged, and feet flat on the floor.
2. Pull Down: Pull the bar down towards your upper chest, keeping your back straight and elbows close to your body.  Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the bottom of the movement.
3. Controlled Return: Slowly return the bar to the starting position, maintaining control and tension in your back muscles.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form, but challenges you on the last 2 reps.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Sit down at a lat pull-down machine and adjust the knee pad to fit snugly against your thighs. Grip the bar with a neutral grip (palms facing each other).
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Sit upright with your back straight, core engaged, and feet flat on the floor.
2. Pull Down: Pull the bar down towards your upper chest, keeping your back straight and elbows close to your body.  Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the bottom of the movement.
3. Controlled Return: Slowly return the bar to the starting position, maintaining control and tension in your back muscles.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight that allows for 8 controlled repetitions with good form. The weight should be challenging but allow for proper execution.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on a controlled movement and avoid using momentum.  Maintain a slight bend in your elbows throughout the exercise.

exercises.setup: Sit down at a lat pull-down machine and adjust the knee pad to fit snugly against your thighs. Grip the bar with a neutral grip (palms facing each other).
execution: 1. Starting Position: Sit upright with your back straight, core engaged, and feet flat on the floor.
2. Pull Down: Pull the bar down towards your upper chest, keeping your back straight and elbows close to your body.  Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the bottom of the movement.
3. Controlled Return: Slowly return the bar to the starting position, maintaining control and tension in your back muscles.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form, but challenges you on the last 2 reps.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Adjust the chest supported row machine to a comfortable height. Lean forward, supporting your chest on the pads, and grip the handle.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Lean forward, supporting your chest on the pads, and grip the handle with an overhand grip, slightly wider than shoulder-width.
2. Pull: Pull the handle towards your abdomen, keeping your back straight and elbows close to your body.  Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the bottom of the movement.
3. Controlled Return: Slowly return the handle to the starting position, maintaining control and tension in your back muscles.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight that allows for 8 controlled repetitions with good form. The weight should be challenging but allow for proper execution.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on a controlled movement and avoid using momentum.  Maintain a slight bend in your elbows throughout the exercise.

exercises.setup: Position yourself on a preacher bench, resting your upper arms comfortably against the pad.  Grip the bar with an overhand grip, slightly narrower than shoulder-width.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Rest your upper arms against the pad, keeping your elbows locked in place.  Your forearms should be hanging down.
2. Curl: Curl the weight upwards, focusing on squeezing your biceps at the top of the movement.
3. Controlled Lowering: Slowly lower the weight back to the starting position, maintaining tension in your biceps.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form, but challenges you on the last 2 reps.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Adjust the machine preacher curl to a comfortable height. Sit down and rest your upper arms against the pad. Grip the handles.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Rest your upper arms against the pad, keeping your elbows locked in place.  Your forearms should be hanging down.
2. Curl: Curl the weight upwards, focusing on squeezing your biceps at the top of the movement.
3. Controlled Lowering: Slowly lower the weight back to the starting position, maintaining tension in your biceps.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight that allows for 8 controlled repetitions with good form. The weight should be challenging but allow for proper execution.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on a controlled movement and avoid using momentum.  Maintain a slight bend in your elbows throughout the exercise.

exercises.setup: Set up the cable at hand height, face away, and take one or two steps forward. Grip the cable handle with an underhand grip.
execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent, and core engaged.  Your arms should be fully extended.
2. Curl: Curl the weight upwards, focusing on squeezing your biceps at the top of the movement.
3. Controlled Lowering: Slowly lower the weight back to the starting position, maintaining tension in your biceps.
exercises.weight: Choose a weight that allows you to complete 8 reps with good form, but challenges you on the last 2 reps.
exercises.alternative_exercise_setup: Hold a dumbbell in each hand with an underhand grip. Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent, and core engaged.
alternative_exercise_execution: 1. Starting Position: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent, and core engaged.  Your arms should be fully extended.
2. Curl: Curl the weight upwards, focusing on squeezing your biceps at the top of the movement.
3. Controlled Lowering: Slowly lower the weight back to the starting position, maintaining tension in your biceps.
exercises.alternative_exercise_weight: Select a weight that allows for 8 controlled repetitions with good form. The weight should be challenging but allow for proper execution.
exercises.additional_tips: Focus on a controlled movement and avoid using momentum.  Maintain a slight bend in your elbows throughout the exercise.
